article_title: Swedish Premier Vows More Security After Fatal Stabbing at Asylum Home
article_text:
STOCKHOLM—Sweden’s Prime Minister Stefan Löfven pledged to give police more resources to maintain security at the country’s asylum centers after a teenage migrant was held on suspicion of killing an employee at a shelter home on Monday.

The victim, a female member of staff at a home for young immigrants in Mölndal, on Sweden’s western coast near Gothenburg, died from stab wounds. The suspect, a 15-year-old refugee, was overpowered by...
